channel.title: R on Gray Analytics
channel.description: Recent content in R on Gray Analytics

item.title: Data Synthesis Part 1
item.description: This post is less of a how to and more of an algorithm idea. Inspired by random walk and monte carlo, I wanted to write an algorithm that could be used to synthetically upsample data that is a mixture of factoral and numeric data, where the columns are not independent. My original hope was to synthesize factoral combinations. But that doesn’t work. Without outside knowledge of what factorial column combinations are allowed, I have to work with the combinations present in the input data.
